verses.verse: Now the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> "One <S%H259><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> plague <S%H5061><s%> I will bring <S%H935><s%> on Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> and on Egypt; <S%H4714><s%> after <S%H310><s%> that he will let <S%H7971><s%> you go <S%H7971><s%> from here. <S%H2088><s%> When he lets <S%H7971><s%> you go, <S%H7971><s%> he will surely <S%H1644><s%> drive <S%H1644><s%> you out from here <S%H2088><s%> completely. <S%H3617><s%>

"Speak <S%H1696><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> that each <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> ask <S%H7592><s%> from his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> and each <S%H802><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> from her neighbor <S%H7468><s%> for articles <S%H3627><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> and articles <S%H3627><s%> of gold. <S%H2091><s%>"

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the Egyptians. <S%H4714><s%> Furthermore, <S%H1571><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> [himself] was greatly <S%H3966><s%> esteemed in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> [both] in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of Pharaoh's servants <S%H5650><s%> and in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the people. <S%H5971><s%>

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> 'About midnight <S%H2676><s%> <S%H3915><s%> I am going <S%H3318><s%> out into the midst <S%H8432><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%>

and all <S%H3605><s%> the first-born in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> shall die, <S%H4191><s%> from the first-born of the Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> who sits <S%H3427><s%> on his throne, <S%H3678><s%> even <S%H5704><s%> to the first-born of the slave <S%H8198><s%> girl <S%H8198><s%> who <S%H834><s%> is behind <S%H310><s%> the millstones; <S%H7347><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the first-born of the cattle <S%H929><s%> as well.

'Moreover, there shall be a great <S%H1419><s%> cry <S%H6818><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> such <S%H834><s%> <S%H3644><s%> as there has not been <S%H1961><s%> [before] and such <S%H3644><s%> as shall never <S%H3808><s%> be again. <S%H3254><s%>

'But against any <S%H3605><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> a dog <S%H3611><s%> shall not [even] bark, <S%H2782><s%> <S%H3956><s%> whether <S%H4480><s%> against man <S%H376><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> beast, <S%H929><s%> that you may understand <S%H3045><s%> how <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> makes <S%H6395><s%> a distinction <S%H6395><s%> between <S%H996><s%> Egypt <S%H4714><s%> and Israel. <S%H3478><s%>'

"And all <S%H3605><s%> these <S%H428><s%> your servants <S%H5650><s%> will come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to me and bow <S%H7812><s%> themselves before me, saying, <S%H559><s%> 'Go <S%H3318><s%> out, you and all <S%H3605><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> who <S%H834><s%> follow <S%H7272><s%> you,' and after <S%H310><s%> that I will go <S%H3318><s%> out." And he went <S%H3318><s%> out from Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> in hot <S%H2750><s%> anger. <S%H639><s%>

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> "Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> will not listen <S%H8085><s%> to you, so <S%H4616><s%> that My wonders <S%H4159><s%> will be multiplied <S%H7235><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>"

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron <S%H175><s%> performed <S%H6213><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> these <S%H428><s%> wonders <S%H4159><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Pharaoh; <S%H6547><s%> yet the Lord <S%H3068><s%> hardened <S%H2388><s%> Pharaoh's heart, <S%H3820><s%> and he did not let <S%H7971><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> go <S%H7971><s%> out of his land. <S%H776><s%>
